info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 19 at 1:33PM MDT until June 21 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 106 or 107 expected today and Tuesday with temperatures up to 108 degrees Wednesday. * WHERE...Chaves County Plains. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, until 8 PM MDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from Noon to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. For the third Heat Advisory, from Noon to 8 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
